full_text: Deere apap 2019/KER/1049 IN THE HIGH COURT OF KERALA AT ERNAKULAM PRESENT THE HONOURABLE MR. JUSTICE K.ABRAHAM MATHEW WEDNESDAY , THE 09TH DAY OF JANUARY 2019 / 19TH POUSHA, 1940 Crl.MC.No. 212 of 2019 cc 171/2018 OF J.M.F.C.-I, THODUPUZHA CRIME NO. 2195/2017 OF THODUPUZHA POLICE STATION , IDUKKI PETITIONER/S: 1 MATHEWS KOLLAPPILLI, AGED 21 YEARS, S/O SABU, KOLLAPPILLIL HOUSE, PAZHUKKAKKALAM BHAGOM, MUTHALAKODAM KARA, KARIKKODE VILLAGE, THODUPUZHA 2 GOKUL T.R., AGED 21 YEARS, S/O REJILAL, THACHUKUZHIYIL HOUSE, MUNDEKALLU BHAGOM, THODUPUZHA 3 SARATH KRISHNAMOHAN, AGED 23 YEARS, S/O MOHANAN, MOOZHIKKAL HOUSE, KUZHIKKAKAVU BHAGOM, ARIKUZHA KARA, MANAKKAD VILLAGE, THODUPUZHA 4 BHARATH KRISHNA, AGED 23 YEARS, S/O AJITH KUMAR, VANIYAPALLIL HOUSE, EDAKKAD KAYATTAM BHAGOM, MADAKKATHANAM KARA, MAJALLOOR VILLAGE, THODUPUZHA 5 NAVIN JOSE, AGED 19 YEARS, S/O JOSE, KELAKATH HOUSE, PAZHUKKAKALAM BHAGOM, MUTHALAKODAM KARA, KARIKKODE VILLAGE, THODUPUZHA BY ADV. SRI.THOMAS J.ANAKKALLUNKAL seen noid Elz 2019/KER/1049 Crl.MC.No. 212 of 2019 Li2e. RESPONDENT/S: 1 STATE OF KERALA REPRESENTED BY THE PUBLIC PROSECUTOR, HIGH COURT OF KERALA, ERNAKULAM - 682031 2 JISTO, AGED 20, S/O PYARISON, PARAYANIKKAL HOUSE, THEKKUMBHAGOM KARA, KARIKODE VILLAGE, THODUPUZHA, IDUKKI DISTRICT - 685505xX 3 SUNEESH, AGED 21 YEARS, S/O RAJAN, NJARAVELIL HOUSE, SAMIKAVALA BHAGOM, POOMALAK KARA, VELLYAMATTOM VILLAGE, THODUPUZHA, IDUKKI DISTRICT 685 508 BY ADV. SRI.JACOB J. ANAKKALLUNKAL OTHER PRESENT: SRI C S HRITHWIK-SR PP THIS CRIMINAL MISC. CASE HAVING COME UP FOR ADMISSION ON 09.01.2019, THE COURT ON THE SAME DAY PASSED THE FOLLOWING: ORDER Petition filed under Section 482 Cr.P.C. 2. The petitioners are the accused in CC No. 171 of 2018 on the file of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Thodupuzha eee 2019/KER/1049 Crl.MC.No. 212 of 2019 1.3.. registered for the offences under Sections 294(b), 323 & 324 of the Indian Penal Code. Respondents 2 & 3 are the victims. It is submitted that the matter has been settled and the proceedings in the criminal case may be quashed. 3. Heard the learned counsel for the petitioners and respondents 2 & 3 and the learned Public Prosecutor. 4. I have perused the affidavits filed by respondents 2 & 3, who have entered appearance through counsel. I am satisfied that the allegation of settlement is true and no public interest is involved. There is no impediment for granting the prayer of the petitioners. In the result, this Crl.M.C. is allowed. The proceedings in CC No. 171 of 2018 on the file of the Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-I, Thodupuzha are quashed. The learned magistrate may pass appropriate orders for the Ee 2019/KER/1049 Crl.MC.No. 212 of 2019 14e. disposal of the material objects, if any, produced in the case. Sd/- K. ABRAHAM MATHEW JUDGE APPENDIX PETITIONER'S/S EXHIBITS: ANNEXURE Al COPY OF THE FINAL REPORT IN C.C.NO.717/2018 PENDING BEFORE THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE COURT- I, THODUPUZHA. ANNEXURE A2 AFFIDAVIT SWORN IN BY THE 2ND RESPONDENT. ANNEXURE A3 AFFIDAVIT SWORN IN BY THE 3RD RESPONDENT. Bka/14.01.2019
